text: Starting Chainsaw, the information that populate the Chainsaw-log are an hour late. (i.e. An issue that happens at 15h00 will be marked at 14h00).  To reproduce the problem, set your PC to the East coast time (Montreal, Canada).
creator: courteau@cae.com
carnold@apache.org
text:
Sounds much more likely to be old time zone data in the JVM than a Chainsaw issue.  Could you update the JVM either by downloading a new one or using the tzupdater program (http://java.sun.com/javase/tzupdater_README.html) and see if the problem goes away.

If it doesn't seem to be a JVM issue, then please at least report OS version, JVM vendor and version, processor type, etc.

creator: courteau@cae.com
text:
The problem was effectively related to the JVM. Downloading the TZupdater package fixed the problem.

thanks.
